title: How to Make Your Own Perforated Pages

steps.title: Place your sheet of paper on a Cutting Mat.
steps.content: Place your sheet of paper on a Cutting Mat.

steps.title: Place a ruler along the line you wish to perforate.
steps.content: Place a ruler along the line you wish to perforate. (if the line is curved, you can cut a cardstock or plastic "guide" to use.)

steps.title: Press the point of a large-headed Quilting Pin through the paper every 1/16th of an inch or less along your line.
steps.content: Press the point of a large-headed Quilting Pin through the paper every 1/16th of an inch or less along your line.

steps.title: Mark 5 degree increments along the outer edge with permanent marker.
steps.content: Mark 5 degree increments along the outer edge with permanent marker.

steps.title: File or grind away the edge between the marks using a Dremel bit or a hand file.
steps.content: File or grind away the edge between the marks using a Dremel bit or a hand file.

steps.title: Leave small, sharp edges/points every 5 degrees.
steps.content: Leave small, sharp edges/points every 5 degrees.

steps.title: Roll your tool along the line to be perforated.
steps.content: Roll your tool along the line to be perforated. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Obtain a rotary Pizza or Pastry cutter.
steps.content: Obtain a rotary Pizza or Pastry cutter.

steps.title: Mark 5 degree increments along the outer edge with Permanent Marker.
steps.content: Mark 5 degree increments along the outer edge with Permanent Marker.

steps.title: Place sewing pins in a radial pattern so that their points overlap the edge by approximately 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm).
steps.content: Place sewing pins in a radial pattern so that their points overlap the edge by approximately 1 ⁄ 4 inch (0.6 cm).

steps.title: Attach the pins to the rotary cutter by one of the following methods:
steps.content: Attach the pins to the rotary cutter by one of the following methods: Superglue (will break of used on anything thicker than a single layer of construction paper) Spot Welding (Can last a very long time) Duct tape (can use only a few times on thin paper)

steps.title: Roll your tool along the line to be perforated.
steps.content: Roll your tool along the line to be perforated.

steps.title: Get a pattern tracing wheel and use it to draw a line across your paper.
steps.content: Get a pattern tracing wheel and use it to draw a line across your paper.

steps.title: The tracing wheel has small spikes on it, so it will make tiny holes on the line, making it easy to tear paper.
steps.content: The tracing wheel has small spikes on it, so it will make tiny holes on the line, making it easy to tear paper. [2] X Research source
